metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7779 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Memory safety bugs were reported in Firefox 54, Firefox ESR 52.2, and Thunderbird 52.2. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort that some of these could be exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 52.3, Firefox ESR < 52.3, and Firefox < 55.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-7779` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 55.0.2+build1-0ubuntu4
firefox-geckodriver - 55.0.2+build1-0ubuntu4
firefox-mozsymbols - 55.0.2+build1-0ubuntu4
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs38 contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '55.0.2+build1-0ubuntu4').
thunderbird package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2').
